properties.Name: MedicalTestType
properties.Description:
A type of medical test.

Ex:
Blood Test
-  Sodium
-  Potassium 
-  Serum Iron (TSI)
-  Ferritin
-  pH
-  Oxygen Saturation
-  Total Protein
-  Total Bilirubin
-  Creatine Kinase (CK)
-  Triglycerides
-  Total Cholesterol
-  HDL Cholesterol
-  LDL Cholesterol
-  PAP
-  TSH
-  Testosterone
-  Progesterone
-  Androstenedione
-  Cortisol
-  Growth Hormone
-  Vitamin E

Brain and Nervous System
-  Carotid ultrasound (carotid doppler)
-  Electromyography and nerve conduction studies
-  Lumbar puncture (or spinal tap)
-  Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brain
-  Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the spine
-  Spinal tap (or lumbar puncture)

Skin, Hair, Nails
-  Skin biopsy

Eyes
-  Fluorescein angiography (for diabetic retinopathy)
-  Snellen test for visual acuity
-  Tonometry

Ears, Nose, and Throat
-  Rapid strep test
-  Scratch test for allergies
-  Throat culture

Bones, Joints, and Muscles
-  Bone density test for osteoporosis
-  Bone scan
-  Computed tomography (CT) for back problems
-  Myelography
-  Back x-rays (spine x-rays)

Lungs
-  Bronchoscopy
-  Chest x-ray
-  Mediastinoscopy
-  Oxygen saturation test
-  Pleural fluid sampling (or thoracentesis)
-  Pulmonary angiogram
-  Pulmonary function testing
-  Sputum evaluation (and sputum induction)
-  Thoracentesis (or pleural fluid sampling)
-  Tuberculosis (TB) skin test
-  Video-assisted thoracic surgery
-  Ventilation-perfusion (or "V-Q" scan)

Heart, Blood Vessels, and Circulation
-  Arterial blood flow studies of the legs
-  Cardiac catheterization
-  Echocardiogram
-  Electrocardiogram
-  Electrophysiological (EP) testing of the heart
-  Exercise stress test
-  Holter monitor
-  Venous ultrasound of the legs

Blood Disorders
-  Bone marrow biopsy
-  Lymph node biopsy

Digestive System
-  Abdominal CT (computed tomography) scan
-  Barium swallow (or upper gastrointestinal series or "upper GI series")
-  Fecal occult blood (FOB) test
-  Upper endoscopy (or esophagogastroduodenoscopy or "EGD")
-  Upper gastrointestinal or upper GI series, (also called barium swallow)
-  Abdominal ultrasound
-  Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP)
-  Liver biopsy
-  Percutaneous transhepatic cholangiography (PTCA)
-  Anoscopy
-  Barium enema
-  Colonoscopy
-  Flexible sigmoidoscopy

Urinary System
-  Cystourethrogram
-  Cystoscopy
-  Intravenous pyelogram
-  Kidney biopsy
-  Radionuclide scan of the kidneys
-  Urinalysis

Hormonal Disorders
-  Thyroid Scan

Infertility, Pregnancy, and Childbirth
-  Endometrial biopsy
-  Hysterosalpingogram
-  Hysteroscopy
-  Laparoscopy
-  Pelvic ultrasound and transvaginal ultrasound
-  Amniocentesis
-  Chorionic villus sampling
-  Enhanced alpha fetoprotein test (or "triple screen test")
-  Fetal ultrasound
Triple screen test (or enhanced alpha fetoprotein test)

Columns.Name: MedicalTestTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Medical Test Type.

Columns.Name: MedicalTestTypeName
Columns.Description: The name of a Medical Test Type.

Columns.Name: MedicalTestTypeDescription
Columns.Description: The description of a Medical Test Type.

Columns.Name: MedicalTestCategoryId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Medical Test Category.

Columns.Name: CptCode
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a CPT Code.

Columns.Name: HcpcsCode
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a HCPCS Code.

Columns.Name: ApcCode
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an APC Code.

Columns.Name: CdtCode
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a CDT Code.

Columns.Name: MedicalTestMethodId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Medical Test Method.

Columns.Name: TestEnvironmentTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Test Environment Type.

Columns.Name: SpecimenMethodId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Specimen Method.

Columns.Name: TestTechniqueId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a test technique.

Columns.Name: FullyAutomatedTestIndicator
Columns.Description: With a fully automated system all assay steps are performed automatically, the operator is only required to load reagents/samples and to programme the instrument.

Columns.Name: HospitalProcedureIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the procedure is a hospital procedure.

Columns.Name: InOfficeProcedureIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the procedure is an in-office procedure.

Columns.Name: KineticTestIndicator
Columns.Description: A diagnostic test where the speed of the reaction is measured and the rate at which the signal is produced will reflect the analyte concentration.

Columns.Name: MedicallyNecessaryProcedureIndicator
MedicareApprovedIndicator
Columns.Description: Medical services for which Medicare normally pays.

Columns.Name: PhysicianPerformedProcedureIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the Medical Procedure must be performed by a physician.

Columns.Name: RequiresPriorAuthorizationIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the medical procedure requires prior authorization.

Columns.Name: PanelIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates whether the medical test type is a test panel that consists of multiple individual medical test types.

Columns.Name: StandardWholesalePrice
Columns.Description: The standard, or default, price charged retailers for the Product.

Columns.Name: ListPrice
Columns.Description:
The standard retail price of the Product before the application of any discount.

This is the price that normally appears in catalogs, on purchase orders and invoices.

Columns.Name: TargetReturnPrice
Columns.Description:
A price established as part of a strategy to yield a specific return on investment.

Target-Return Price = (unit cost) + ((desired return)*(invested capital))/unit sales

The Target-Return Price ignores competitor's pricing and price elasticity.

Columns.Name: StandardCost
Columns.Description: The estimated or calculated cost to manufacture or produce the Product.

Columns.Name: ProductMargin
Columns.Description: The difference between the Standard Retail Price of a product and the cost to produce it.

Properties.Description:
A type of medical test.

Ex:
Blood Test
-  Sodium
-  Potassium 
-  Serum Iron (TSI)
-  Ferritin
-  pH
-  Oxygen Saturation
-  Total Protein
-  Total Bilirubin
-  Creatine Kinase (CK)
-  Triglycerides
-  Total Cholesterol
-  HDL Cholesterol
-  LDL Cholesterol
-  PAP
-  TSH
-  Testosterone
-  Progesterone
-  Androstenedione
-  Cortisol
-  Growth Hormone
-  Vitamin E

-  Carotid ultrasound (carotid doppler)
-  Electromyography and nerve conduction studies
-  Lumbar puncture (or spinal tap)
-  Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brain
-  Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the spine
-  Spinal tap (or lumbar puncture)

Skin, Hair, Nails

-  Snellen test for visual acuity
-  Tonometry

Lungs
